intro: Selago montis-shebae, commonly known as the Sheba mountain selago, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the high-altitude regions of the Arabian Peninsula. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hair that helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Selago montis-shebae is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native environment.
